data.title: Love to watch Hockey
data.text: We go often to watch the Rockford Ice Hogs ,Always a Great time ,and on some Some Sundays you can even skate with the Ice Hogs After the game ,This is always cool because the sign Autographs ,the kids love it as well as any Adult Blackhawks fan as many of the boys have made it to the big time

data.title: Nice place to watch a game
data.text: We love going to the BMO and watching Ice Hogs Hockey. This is a nice facility and has some upgrades. The people working the doors are a little rude but overall we like going out for a night at the BMO.

data.title: The entire building is behind in its time
data.text: You want a flash back of the 80's for sports events or any entertainment, them this is the place for you! Its way to small, food is horrible and way over priced, jus like beer! Why charge so much when you dont update anything! Its a sad location when it comes to Monster Trucks also! There is no room! Its a big mistake overall!! Change should be made!

data.title: BMO. Harris Bank Center
data.text: A nice 7000 seat stadium. Not a bad seat in the house. Easy access for wheel chair bound or handicapped. I've been to quite a few IceHogs games, and this venue is the best kept secret in Rockford. Pretty good food and selection overall. Clean, well lit, and easy to get around. Parking is a little limited so arrive early if possible. Pack some ear plugs. They over play the music at every stoppage of play, conversation limited to between periods or during play. Very family friendly and affordable.

data.title: Great Hockey Atmosphere!
data.text: Excellent arena for hockey, home of the Rockford Ice Hogs!  Any seat in the house is a great view!  See up and coming Chicago Blackhawks players up close.

data.title: Good arena
data.text: We have been to BMO for many different events, concerts, expos, sporting events, etc.  I have always had good experiences there.  There is always a good amount of security at concerts and sporting events.  They allow people to have a good time but don't allow jerks to ruin others' good time.  Their concession prices are typical concession prices...overpriced but not outrageous like some large city events.  We just eat before we go there.

data.title: Logistics Rule!
data.text: Easy parking, restaurants nearby for before or after events, and really no bad seat in the house.  Compared to traveling to venues in Chicago or the suberbs, this is fantastic!

data.title: News Boys concert
data.text: Concert was great.  The building was clean and comfortable and well managed.  Was easy to get in and get out.

data.title: Nice Venue
data.text: I liked this arena.  It was cheap for parking, and the food was nice as well.  I liked the atmosphere.  I had a panizza which was really good.  Hockey team struggled on the night I went, but it was a really neat arena to go to.

data.title: nice concert venue
data.text: nice concert venue for a smaller area.  Nice to not have to deal with downtown Chicago.  Clean bathrooms

data.title: A Decent Bank If There Is Such A Thing
data.text: Not much to say here other than it is a bank.  I occasionally make a car payment here.  Building is clean and neat.  I have always found BMO employees to be very friendly and helpful.

data.title: nice place
data.text: went to see the Ice Hogs the parking was cheap $5.00. The beer prices were high $9 for a beer is high.

data.title: Good place for a hockey game
data.text: The BMO (Metro Center) is a decent place to take the family for a concert or hockey game. It's a typical midsize stadium with food and drink vendors, but we prefer to eat at a local restaurant before we go.  Parking could be improved, but no real complaints.

data.title: Great place to be to watch a game... Horrible to get in and out of the area
data.text: If you are heading to an Ice Hogs game or any other event at the Harris Bank Center make sure you have plenty of time to get there.  The actual venue is okay, but the parking and the area around the venue is terrible!  There is a parking garage right across the street.  They have a staff there to press the button for you to get a ticket.  Yes they just stand there and press the button.  Once you park you have to pay before you leave at a pay station.  There is only ONE pay station for the whole 4 floors of parking and it is on the first floor in the vestibule.  LINES OUT THE DOOR and wait for at least 30 minutes plus to pay.  Then once you do pay it is at least 30 minutes or more to get out because those same employees pressing the button for you to get your ticket are there at the bottom to put your paid ticket in the machine!  SERIOUSLY!?  Just take my money and it would go a lot faster.  Terrible!  The only reason we went into the parking garage is because there is no parking anywhere around the venue unless you have a VIP pass.  Plus all the roads are one way so if you miss something you have to go around.  Then there are no police to direct traffic so you have long lines.  Just terrible.  Then once you finally do park, it is off to the venue only to wait in the long lines there.  Be warned, you get frisked as you walk into the venue and they do not allow ANYTHING.  So you have to go back into your car to put whatever away.  I was waiting for my husband along with at least half a dozen other people.  The actual arena is great to watch a game.  All seats are great.  Lines for concessions are crazy but they go kind of fast, they do not have any vendors walking up and down the aisle for safety reasons (I totally get that).  Prices are decent.  It is a fun and inexpensive way to enjoy a hockey game.  Just figure out the parking and it would be perfect!!

data.title: Convenient and the staff are great
data.text: We frequent the BMO for IceHogs games, and the entertainment value for the money can't be beat. Parking is right across the street for $5, the staff at the BMO are friendly and professional, and the building has been well maintained in recent years, especially. I saw a concert here several years ago, and the sound was decent. For sporting events, there isn't a bad seat in the house.

data.title: A good place to watch a hockey game
data.text: The BMO Harris Bank Center (aka Metro Center) is in downtown Rockford.  It is the home of the AHL Rockford Ice Hogs hockey club and a good place to watch a game.  Seats are comfortable and anything between the blue lines upper or lower level provides a good view.  Tickets are around $20.  Atmosphere is typical of minor league hockey venues but not overly rowdy with plenty of family patrons.  Lots of good concessions.  Try the District restaurant two blocks away for your pre/post game meal

data.title: Rockford Ice Hogs Hockey game
data.text: Had a great time! Better than I expected,  although we were by ourselves,  the staff during the game were very kid friendly!  Reasonably priced and lot's of enjoyment for the entire family!  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Blackhawks light
data.text: Newly upgraded and named, the old Metro Center is home to the AHL Rockord Icehogs, AAA farm team for the Chicago Blackhawks.  See the next generation of NHL stars in their last stop before the big time up close and personal and at a fraction of the cost of going to Chicago for a game.  Have sell-outs for many of the premium games, check ticket availability before you drive to Rockford.  Family friendly, great value for hockey fans.

data.title: Rockford IceHogs game
data.text: Went to the IceHogs game the other day and had a great time. The tickets that I wanted were held for me at the box office without the extra fees of ordering online, they don't normally do this but they made an exception. The set up is great and you can see the action from anywhere. We ate before we got to the game so I'm not sure about food prices. I love this place and will always come back, it'll always be the MetroCentre to me however.

data.title: Awsome
data.text: I have loved coming there for icehogs games and school graduation. Everything is always looking nice and kept up.
